alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Frederick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:42AM EST until January 31 at 1:38AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Virginia, including the following counties, Clarke and Frederick. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 839 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. A gauge on Opequon Creek near Berryville is rising toward flood stage. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenwood... Brucetown... Armel... Wadesville... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Locations along Opequon Creek, including Old Charles Town Road and Sulphur Springs Road. Carpers Valley Road at Buffalo Lick Run and Valley Mill Road near Abrams Creek. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
